This, the more evidence you send her, the more mad she will be at him. Not you. 

She is mad at you because you are not replying and ghosting a situation she CANNOT get away from due to her pregnancy. 

She is going to keep wondering til you send her photos, screen shots, him lying to you, saying he got her pregnant by a drunk one nighter. Etc. 

Also, never date a guy who is living with his ex. It‚Äôs baggage you clearly don‚Äôt want

If he chooses to stay, be prepared to give him all your passwords, let him question you, share your location, and do anything he needs to do to make sure he is comfortable. 

Tell him before someone else does.

Those are indeed red flags. It does sound like he is lying. You know for sure those items were not there last week so why would he move them there if they were not his?? 

If you want to continue the relationship (and it sounds like you do- no judgment here) then keep your eyes open and remain skeptical. Otherwise, leave.

Edit: you can try talking to him about your worries but I would gain more evidence first.
Key thing here is to learn and not make the same mistake.
Yes, communication is so important. Especially at the beginning of the relationship.
Sounds like an addict. If you stick around, there will be a long bumpy road ahead of you. With a lot of disappointment
Where are you located? State/country wise? It‚Äôll help in determining what they can do

Can you promise me if he forgets you will back off from the relationship, or at least end it all together? You deserve so much more. I promise there is someone out there who will appreciate you. Tell you happy Valentine‚Äôs Day, get you flowers, tell you you are beautiful, and check in on you.

Keep that boundary, don‚Äôt even get him candy, soda, a shirt on clearance. Nothing. 

As for Valentine‚Äôs Day, that is fucked up. It really does sound like he is using you. 

If he doesn‚Äôt contribute physical things then what does he contribute that is non physical? Is he there for you when you are crying or having a hard day? Does he check in on you daily? Give you compliments(not when getting gifts, just in general)?
You should try r/legaladvice
Even though OP is a virgin, I would agree. Brushing up beside her or using the same toilet could have transmitted something.
Maybe explain you guys should try a variety of sex. Like passionate, soft and loving, and kinky.

Test him by not getting him anything else. If he asks just say you can‚Äôt right now. If he stays after 6 + months of not giving then he loves you. 

A relationship is suppose to me give and take. You are turning yourself into a sugar mama
Agreed. They are everywhere in the Arkansas, US. Often purple and green varieties but pink is popular too.

Honestly yes, my parent toxic relationship made me want them to divorce. It hurt me more knowing they were staying in it for me. They tried to hide the toxicity and act like they were in it for love but no. 

Just some insight. Either way, whatever choice you make. Do it for your health. To show your kids that health is more important than relationships

As a female, it puts weight on my shoulders when guys will drop anything and everything for you. And turn their life into you. It feels like I have to be the lead in the relationship. Bleh. 

Also, can we talk about guys who claim to be nice guys but are not. At. All. I had a guy let me borrow his beanie while we were on a group camping trip in college. I accidentally took it home. He asked to come get it(of course I said sure). He came to get it and asked me on a date. I said no. And he, no joke, said ‚ÄúI LET YOU BORROW MY BEANIE WHILE I FROZE. THAT IS HOW NICE OF A GUY I AM. WHY DONT YOU WANT TO BE WITH ME.‚Äù

Have you guys ever thought about watching porn together? Specifically role play porn that you like. That way she can see porn that was made in the last 2-5 years. 

I wish you the best of luck and I‚Äôm glad you are able to hold it back. If you end up laughing(and don‚Äôt want to say way), tell her it reminds you of a play you did as a child or a funny memory.
Thank you.

No it was not planned. I moved 4 states away to be with him/start my dream job. Once I moved here I saw dick pics on his phone. He didn‚Äôt get physical with anyone. It was kik app. I saw everything. I was planning on leaving from there. Saving up and becoming distant. Then I got sick. Really sick. I took a pregnancy test because I was showing similar symptoms. It came out positive. So I figured I will give him a second chance because there is a baby on board. I thought I could handle it. But mentally it is bothering the shit out of me. I look through his phone often. Worry about where he is (he shares his location with me). Etc. 

He is a good guy aside from the one bump we have had. He‚Äôs driven, gonna be a good dad for sure, adventurous, loves the same hobbies I do, and ensures I go outside to feel better.
Nope. My pregnancy is a rough one. I cannot work right now

He has been supportive honestly. Let‚Äôs me look through his phone (although tonight he had a bad attitude about it and we got in a fight because he said ‚ÄúI need to grow up‚Äù)
He cooks, goes shopping for me, cleans, makes the bed, makes sure I take my meds. He‚Äôs excited about the baby too. I just don‚Äôt know how to help clear my head and stop worrying.
I follow them! Thank you, they are helpful

I can‚Äôt afford to. My pregnancy has been so rough I can‚Äôt work. After the first trimester I plan to start work again and save up. Possibly to leave. I‚Äôm just scared. He cooks and cleans for me since I can‚Äôt. And I‚Äôm scared to not have that nearby.
I can‚Äôt leave. I have no family or friends nearby.
Good deal! Sounds like you are in a healthy relationship!

I‚Äôm 24f and my partner is 34m, honestly he stays active. Zach likes to ski, kayak, hike, etc. so he keeps up with me. We are having a surprise baby and he is so beyond excited. I honestly think if I dated a guy in his 20s then he would not be excited. 

Our one issue is that he wants to get married and settle. He is okay with working while I stay at home but I am not okay with that. Nor am I prepared for marriage.  

Edit: 
Just know your man will be comfortable with questions men our age wouldn‚Äôt be. Like ‚Äúdo you want kids‚Äù ‚Äúdo you like the idea of marriage‚Äù etc.

Healing is messy, it‚Äôs okay to have bad days or moments. Take care of yourself.  Take a bath, cook a fancy dinner just for you, get dressed up for you. Do things for you. 

Agree with the comments though, sounds like he‚Äôs gonna pay for it later

If you absolutely want to make him feel comfortable. Tell him he could have looked through your phone or could still. This is really only acceptable if it‚Äôs post infidelity of some kind.

If you have his password, maybe look without telling him so he doesn‚Äôt have time to delete anything? Not sure how that will go though. My SO cheated through sexting and now he lets me look through whatever I want on his phone because he knows it temporarily comforts me and builds trust

So if he is a private person, wouldn‚Äôt he want to make it so other people don‚Äôt see how much of a creep he is online? The private person portion sounds like an excuse. 

Now the girls he‚Äôs following, do they live in your town or are they abroad models? 

Either way, this is a red flag and your feelings are fully justified. Don‚Äôt let him minimize how you feel.
If possibly, evidence might be helpful in this.
The same thing happened to me as a teenager. My one advice is to Please ask your parents to get you in therapy so you can properly process what has happened.

Every person has a good side and a bad side. If you can look past her talking to her ex, being on dating site, and possibly cheating then continue the relationship. But if you can‚Äôt look past it, maybe start using those dating apps yourself.

She‚Äôs playing you. She is good with her words. I had an ex like this. Do you end up feeling bad at the end of the conversations? Do era she make your feelings feel invalid? If so, she is toxic.

Foreplay is so important. Talk about how you love foreplay. Do you always initiate sex? I often do, I found that if I wait and let my partner initiate sex then I‚Äôm more likely get foreplay.

To start, what do you consider cheating? Everyone is mildly different although There is a commonality; no physical touching, no hidden emotional relationships with the opposite gender, etc. 

From there, you can decide if he cheated. For me, I tell the men i date at the beginning (I am a boundary setting type person, comes from childhood trauma and therapy) that 1. Dating apps are cheating 2. Sexting or flirty messages is considered cheating 3. Physical touching 4. Hidden emotional relationships. 

From what I see: if you consider downloading dating apps, messaging in flirty ways, and hanging out with females+hiding it cheating. Then he did indeed cheat. 

It‚Äôs all about how you define it.

Or
